info.description:
Use AWS Resource Access Manager to share AWS resources between AWS accounts. To share a resource, you create a resource share, associate the resource with the resource share, and specify the principals that can access the resource. The following principals are supported:

  • The ID of an AWS account

  • The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an OU from AWS Organizations

  • The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an organization from AWS Organizations

If you specify an AWS account that doesn't exist in the same organization as the account that owns the resource share, the owner of the specified account receives an invitation to accept the resource share. After the owner accepts the invitation, they can access the resources in the resource share. An administrator of the specified account can use IAM policies to restrict access resources in the resource share.
info.title: AWS Resource Access Manager

post.description: Accepts an invitation to a resource share from another AWS account.

clientToken.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

invitationTimestamp.description: The date and time when the invitation was sent.

receiverAccountId.description: The ID of the AWS account that received the invitation.

resourceShareArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.

resourceShareAssociations.description: The resources associated with the resource share.

items.description: Describes an association with a resource share.

associatedEntity.description: The associated entity. For resource associations, this is the ARN of the resource. For principal associations, this is the ID of an AWS account or the ARN of an OU or organization from AWS Organizations.

creationTime.description: The time when the association was created.

external.description: Indicates whether the principal belongs to the same organization as the AWS account that owns the resource share.

lastUpdatedTime.description: The time when the association was last updated.

resourceShareArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.

statusMessage.description: A message about the status of the association.

resourceShareInvitationArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the invitation.

resourceShareName.description: The name of the resource share.

senderAccountId.description: The ID of the AWS account that sent the invitation.

clientToken.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

resourceShareInvitationArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the invitation.
